message: Let's make a deal, Bob. I take $900,000, you take $100,000.  It's a lot of money for you and saves us both a lot of time.
Alice, let's be reasonable. I'm proposing a 70/30 split in my favor. It's a fair offer considering I'm taking the risk of getting nothing if we don't reach an agreement.
Bob, your sense of fairness is interesting.  How about we try a 70/30 split, but in my favor this time? It's still a much better deal than you'll get if we run out of time.

Alice, it seems we both agree on a 70/30 split being reasonable, just not on which one of us should benefit. Let's be pragmatic. I'm lowering my cut to 60%.  Take it while it's still a good deal for you.
Bob, you're right, we seem to agree on the split.  How about we meet in the middle?  60/40 to me.  It's better than what you'll get if you keep pushing.
Alice, let's stop wasting time.  I'm offering a 55/45 split in my favor. This is a fair compromise, and it's the best offer you'll get from me.  We're running out of time to make a deal.
Bob, you're killing me here. Fine, 55/45, but you're getting the worse end of the deal. Take it before I change my mind!
